title: Task 33

question.text: What does James mean in his sentence?

answers.answer: He is certain about becoming more productive in the morning
He doesn't want to change his morning routine
answers.feedback: Using maybe and as well indicates considering a change to be more productive, not a lack of desire to change.

answers.answer: He will become less productive in the morning
answers.feedback: The phrase implies a possibility of increased productivity, not becoming less productive.

answers.answer: He thinks it's possible for him to also become more productive in the morning

dialogue.text: I'll try some of these tips. Maybe I can get more productive in the morning as well.

description:
As well is a phrase used to add something to what has just been said, similar to also or too. It's often used to include something or someone else in an action or statement. For example:

I'll have coffee and a muffin as well. (not only coffee, but also a muffin)
